intro: Oxydectes atrorufa, commonly known as the red-bellied spider orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers with distinctive red-brown markings. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and forest floors. Its roots form symbiotic relationships with mycorrhizal fungi, aiding in nutrient absorption. Oxydectes atrorufa is a rare and endangered species, requiring specific environmental conditions for successful growth and reproduction.
